msContents.summary: This text constitutes an agricultural account over expenses incurred in the early months of an unknown year in the course of farming operations. The land in question may have been devoted to a vineyard, a reed-bed, and a vegetable garden. The phrasing of the tripartite total recorded in line 13 shows that the account was compiled by the manager of a private estate for submission to the owner. Expenses in terms of money were itemized at the right side of the text line by line, but these figures have been stripped away. Their total, however, is presented in the last line of the column.

condition.ab: This papyrus is regularly cut off at the right side, carrying with it the itemization of expenses in terns of money as they were given line by line.

handDesc.p: A narrow and now variable margin, nowhere as much as 1 cm., runs down the left side, but there is an impressive margin of ca. 1.8 cm. at the bottom. The right side of the papyrus has been stripped away.

div.ab: "Watering the . . . , 4 workers,;Embanking the water-channel of the 2-aroura plot . . . ,;Clearing away brushwood in the area devoted to kolophonion, 4 workers . . .,;To Satabous, donkey-driver, as wages for Phaophi and Hathyr . . . ,;Gathering sabautia in the area devoted to kolophonion in Hadrianos . . . ,;Watering the plot of twenty arouras, together with the . . . , 4 workers . . .,;Charge for transport on a donkey that brought up olive-oil . . . ,;Work performed by Satabous, teamster, on Hathyr 16 . . . ,;The ox-team worked 14 days . . . ,;and was used for transport 12 days . . . ,;and was idle 4 days . . .,;Total of ewxpenditures 198 dr.; reimbursement received 192 dr.;; remainder still owing 6 dr."
